Docs.param: A object that provides the data for the block.
An optional hash value used to ensure transactional integrity for the block. May be null or an empty string.
An object that represents the condition that must be met in order for the request to proceed. If null, no condition is used.
A object that specifies additional options for the request. If null, default options are applied to the request.

Docs.summary: Commits a new block of data to the end of the blob.
Docs.returns: The offset at which the block was appended.
Docs.remarks: Clients may send the Content-MD5 header for a given Append Block operation as a means to ensure transactional integrity over the wire. The parameter permits clients who already have access to a pre-computed MD5 value for a given byte range to provide it. If the property is set to true and the parameter is set to null, then the client library will calculate the MD5 value internally.

Docs.summary: Appends the contents of a byte array to an append blob.Recommended only for single-writer scenarios.
Docs.remarks: Use this method only in single-writer scenarios. Internally, this method uses the append-offset conditional header to avoid duplicate blocks, which may cause problems in multiple-writer scenarios. If you have a single-writer scenario, see to determine whether setting this flag to true is acceptable for your scenario.

Docs.remarks: Clients may send the Content-MD5 header for a given Append Block operation as a means to ensure transactional integrity over the wire. The parameter permits clients who already have access to a pre-computed MD5 value for a given byte range to provide it. If the property is set to true and the parameter is set to null, then the client library will calculate the MD5 value internally.

Docs.summary: Uploads the contents of a byte array to an append blob. If the blob already exists, it will be overwritten. Recommended only for single-writer scenarios.
Docs.remarks: Use this method only in single-writer scenarios. Internally, this method uses the append-offset conditional header to avoid duplicate blocks, which may cause problems in multiple-writer scenarios. If you have a single-writer scenario, see to determine whether setting this flag to true is acceptable for your scenario. To append data to an append blob that already exists, see .

If you have a single-writer scenario, see to determine whether setting this flag to true is acceptable for your scenario. To append data to an append blob that already exists, see .

Docs.param: A string containing the text to upload.
A object that indicates the text encoding to use. If null, UTF-8 will be used.
An object that represents the condition that must be met in order for the request to proceed.
A object that specifies additional options for the request.
An object that represents the context for the current operation.
A object to handle messages.
A to observe while waiting for a task to complete.
Docs.summary: Initiates an asynchronous operation to upload a string of text to an append blob. If the blob already exists, it will be overwritten. Recommended only for single-writer scenarios.
Docs.returns: A object that represents the asynchronous operation.
Docs.remarks: Use this method only in single-writer scenarios. Internally, this method uses the append-offset conditional header to avoid duplicate blocks, which may cause problems in multiple-writer scenarios. If you have a single-writer scenario, see to determine whether setting this flag to true is acceptable for your scenario. To append data to an append blob that already exists, see .
